abstract: Tony La Russa, the manager of the St. Louis Cardinals, and Jim Leyland, the manager of the Detroit Tigers, have concluded that there were certain advantages to being the underdog and visiting team in an elimination game.
snippet: Tony La Russa, the manager of the St. Louis Cardinals, and Jim Leyland, the manager of the Detroit Tigers, have concluded that there were certain advantages to being the underdog and visiting team in an elimination game.
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA - Tony La Russa, the manager of the St. Louis Cardinals, quipped Friday afternoon that he spoke more often with Jim Leyland, the manager of the Detroit Tigers, than he did with members of his own family.

headline.main: La Russa and Leyland Share the Advantages of the Underdog
